metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5404 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The cert_revoke command in FreeIPA does not check for the "revoke certificate" permission, which allows remote authenticated users to revoke arbitrary certificates by leveraging the "retrieve certificate" permission. It was discovered that FreeIPA incorrectly handled certificates. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service by revoking arbitrary certificates.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5404` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeipa-admintools - 4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1
freeipa-client - 4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1
freeipa-common - 4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1
freeipa-server - 4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1
freeipa-server-dns - 4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1
freeipa-server-trust-ad - 4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1
freeipa-tests - 4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1
python-ipaclient - 4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1
python-ipalib - 4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1
python-ipaserver - 4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1
python-ipatests - 4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: freeipa package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.1-0ubuntu1+esm1').
